str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A king, ruler, but in some passages clearly to be translated: emperor. Probably from basis; a sovereign.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
An oath. From herkos; a limit, i.e. restraint.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To recline at table with. From sun and anakeimai; to recline in company with.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To command, order, direct, bid. From a primary kello; 'hail'; to incite by word, i.e. Order.
To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
